Autoplay Videos when lovelace dashboard is active. Enabling this setting may increase data usage unexpectedly, proceed with caution.
Home Assistant does not have access to run in the background. Without this permission the app will not be able to reliably send data back to your server. Click here to request permissions.
Home Assistant has access to run in the background.
Unlock using your biometric or screenlock credential

Are you sure? This cannot be undone. If you accidentally deleted the wrong widget you will need to remove the bad widget from the home screen and create a new one.
Make sure your phone is connected\nto your home internet.
Help the developers fix bugs and crashes by leaving this enabled. If the application crashes this will automatically generate and send a report. If you notice a crash also create an issue on Github!
Unable to send migration failure event to Home Assistant
Database migration failed, all sensor and widget data has been reset. Please re-enable your sensors and recreate your widgets.
Create a shortcut to this item?
Template value must not be blank
All required permissions will be requested upon enabling

Enabling this sensor will allow the Home Assistant application to track you location and report it back to your instance of Home Assistant. Ensure that you enable background access to location, otherwise we cannot enable location tracking. Your location data is sent directly to your Home Assistant instance and is never sent to a 3rd party.
This app collects location data to enable Location Tracking, WiFi Connection Status, and URL decision making even when the app is closed or not in use.
When enabled values will be sent to Home Assistant
Current state and attribute of any entity
It appears that your authorization was revoked, please reconnect to Home Assistant.
Unable to connect to Home Assistant.
Unable to connect to Home Assistant.
Unable to communicate with Home Assistant because of a SSL error. Please ensure your certificate is valid.
Please check to ensure you have the mobile_app\nintegration enabled on your home assistant instance.
Failed to notify HA of picked option.
Failed to send favorites selection to Wear OS
By skipping/ignoring this error you will be unable to receive any push notifications.
Unable to find your\nHome Assistant instance
Do not lock screen when Lovelace dashboard is active
Changing default language may have influence on device entities naming
Please wait while we load your entities

The location is disabled. The following enabled option(s) require you to enable location. If you do not enable the location, the sensor(s)/setting(s) will not work!

%1$s
Do you want to enable location?

The following enabled option(s) require you to enable location. If you do not enable the location, the sensor(s)/setting(s) will not work!

%1$s
Click to enable location.
Some setting(s) do not work. Click to enable location.

Android set up restrictions for apps which want to use your WiFi, because WiFi can be theoretically used to determine your location.

Also to ensure the app can access WiFi in background (URL decision making, sensors) you need to allow location access all the time.

Therefore, to use this option location access all the time is needed.

Continue granting location access?
Use biometric or screenlock credential to unlock app
Log file could not be created.
This device has %1$d available sensors to utilize.
Setup and manage Quick Setting tiles here. They will not function until you set them up here.
Edit your widgets, adding/deleting can only be done from the home screen

Enter the URL of your Home Assistant server. Make sure the URL includes the protocol and port. For example:

http://homeassistant.local:8123 or 
https://example.duckdns.org.
What is your Home Assistant URL?
Control any media player and see current now playing image
The Wear app is installed on all of your wear devices! \n\nStay tuned for more updates to this page.

The Wear app is missing on your watch, click the button below to install the app.\n\nNote: Currently the Wear OS app requires you to be enrolled in the beta for the phone app. If the button does not work then please join the beta: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/io.homeassistant.companion.android

The Wear app is installed on some of your wear devices: (%1$s)

Click the button below to install the app on the other devices.

Note: Currently the Wear OS app requires you to be enrolled in the beta for the phone app. If the button does not work then please join the beta: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/io.homeassistant.companion.android
Please open the Home Assistant app and send the command again in order to grant the proper permissions.
Firing event failed. Please try again.
This tag does not contain Home Assistant data
Place your phone over the nfc tag to read it.
NFC tags written by the app will fire an event once you bring your device near them.\n\nTags will work on any device with Home Assistant installed which has hardware support to read them.
Place phone over nfc tag to write the following identifier to it %1$s
Please fill out the form first
You have not received any notifications yet
When you add a configurable widget to your home screen, you will see it here
Your connection to this site is not private.
Failed to send event on notification cleared
Failed to send event on notification dismissed
History of Notifications (currently displays the last 25 notifications received)
In order to track incoming and outgoing call\'s occurrence we need access to your phone state. No phone numbers or other call details will be stored.

In order to use location tracking features or different connection urls based on WiFi SSID we need access to your location. If you want consistent background updates you will also need to allow background processing
Allow application to detect call occurrence and notify server about it.
Update your location behind the scenes, periodically.
Import existing Home Assistant zones as geofences for zone based tracking.
Always try the internal URL first before the external URL. Enable this setting if you typically leave location off.
You have now sent more than %s notifications today. You will not receive new notifications until midnight UTC.
Your version of Home Assistant does not protect for recently discovered security vulnerabilities in custom components. Please view the details via the bulletin and update as soon as possible.
Select the instance you would like to connect to:
Total count of active notifications that are visible to the user including silent, persistent and the Sensor Worker notifications.
If the app is in the foreground, background or any other state it can be.
Whether the app is currently considered inactive by the system
Total used and available memory for the app
App Rx GB since last device reboot
The apps current standby bucket. Standby buckets determine how much an app will be restricted from running background tasks such as jobs and alarms.
App Tx GB since last device reboot
The state of the devices audio mode
The state of the devices ringer mode
The current battery level of the device
The current charging state of the battery

Send BLE iBeacon with configured interval, used to track presence around house, e.g. together with roomassistant, esp32-mqtt-room or espresence projects.

Warning: this can affect battery life, particularly if the "Transmitter power" setting is set to High or "Advertise Mode" is set to Low latency.
Settings allow for specifying:
- "UUID" (standard UUID format), "Major" and "Minor" (should be 0 - 65535), to tailor identifiers and groups
- "Transmitter Power" and "Advertise Mode" to help to preserve battery life (use lowest values if possible)#n - "Measured Power" to specify power measured at 1m (initial default -59)

Note:
Additionally a separate setting exists ("Enable Transmitter") to stop or start transmitting.
Information about currently connected Bluetooth devices
Whether Bluetooth is enabled on the device
The cell number of the incoming or outgoing call
The type of charger plugged into the device currently
Whether the device is actively charging
The current time zone the device is in
The current activity type as computed by Googles Activity Recognition API
Whether the device is currently locked and requires a PIN, pattern or password to unlock.
Whether the device is secured with a PIN, pattern or password.
The current state of Do Not Disturb
Whether the device is in Doze mode
Information about the total and available storage space externally
Calculated address based on GPS data using Googles Location API
Whether headphones are plugged into the device
Whether the headset is currently in use
Whether high accuracy mode is active on the device
Whether the device is in an interactive state
Information about the total and available storage space internally
Whether the keyguard is currently locked.
Whether the keyguard is secured by a PIN, pattern or password or a SIM card is currently locked.
The details of the last notification. You must setup an allow list or explicitly allow all notifications to be sent.\n\nNote: Sending all notification data will result in heavy battery usage.

The date and time of the devices last reboot. The setting below will allow you to adjust the deadband in milliseconds, if you still find the value to jump incorrectly. The default value is 60000 (1 minute).

The details of the last removed notification. This can be any notification either cleared by the user or removed by an application. You must setup an allow list or explicitly allow all notifications to be sent.\n\nNote: Sending all notification data will result in heavy battery usage.

The intent for the last update that was sent, periodic updates will show as \"SensorWorker\". Enabling the \"Add New Intent\" toggle will create 1 setting to allow you to register for a broadcast intent. The toggle will switch back to off once a new setting is created so you will need to turn it back on to save more intents. You can also clear out the setting value to remove the setting in the next update. You must restart the application after making changes to these settings to take effect.

Allow Home Assistant to send a notification to request an accurate location along with the application periodically requesting an accurate location. The Minimum Accuracy setting will allow you to decide how accurate the device location (in meters) has to be in order to send to Home Assistant. The Minimum time between updates (in milliseconds) keeps the device from sending the accurate location too often. The Include in sensor update setting will make a location request with each sensor update.
Update your location behind the scenes, periodically. The Minimum Accuracy setting will allow you to decide how accurate the device location (in meters) has to be in order to send to Home Assistant.

Import existing Home Assistant zones as geofences for zone based tracking. The Minimum Accuracy setting will allow you to decide how accurate the device location (in meters) has to be in order to send to Home Assistant.

The state will either be the playback state of the primary media session or it will be unavailable when you have no active sessions. Attributes will include data from all active sessions including total count.
Whether the microphone is muted on the device
Whether mobile data roaming is enabled on the device
Whether mobile data is enabled on the device
Total Rx GB on cellular data since last device reboot
Total Tx GB on cellular data since last device reboot
Whether music is actively playing on the device

The date and time of the next scheduled alarm, any app or manufacturer can override the default behavior. The package attribute will tell you which app set the next scheduled alarm. The setting below will create an Allow List so you can specify what packages you want the alarm event from. This will ignore alarm events for packages not selected and the state will not update until the next scheduled alarm matches one of the selected packages.
Whether the phone is ringing or in a call, no other caller information is stored
Whether the device is in Power Save mode
The current ambient air pressure reading
The current proximity reading, some devices only report near or far
The public IP address of the device. Enabling this you agree to use external service https://ipify.org to determine IP address.
Information about the current cellular provider in SIM slot 1
Information about the current cellular provider in SIM slot 2
The confidence rating the user is asleep including attributing factors
Additional one time events from Sleep as Android
Details about the last sleep session
Sleep tracking status from Sleep as Android
Whether speakerphone is enabled on the device
The total number of steps since the last reboot of the device
Information about the total and available storage space internally and externally
Total Rx GB since last device reboot
Total Tx GB since last device reboot
Volume level for alarms on the device
Volume level for calls on the device
Volume level for music on the device
Volume level for the ringer on the device

The mac address of the currently connected WiFi access point. Enabling the \"Get current BSSID\" toggle will create a new setting allowing you to rename the state sent back to Home Assistant for the chosen mac address. The toggle will default to off after the current BSSID is stored, so you will need to enable it once for each BSSID you wish to rename. You can also clear out the value to remove the setting in the next update.
The name of the network the device is currently connected to
The frequency band of the connected network
The current IP address of the device on the network
The current link speed of the device to the connected network
The signal strength of the device to the WiFi network
Whether WiFi is enabled on the device
Whether the work profile is currently active on the device
High accuracy mode (May drain battery fast)
High accuracy mode only when connected to BT devices
High accuracy mode only when entering zone
High accuracy mode trigger range for zone (meters)
Use this to manage what sensors are enabled/disabled.
The following sensors offer custom settings: %1$s
Set Favorites on Wear OS Device
No biometric sensor or screenlock credential available
In order to prepare the logs for sharing, the app needs permissions to access the external storage. Otherwise the log cannot be shared.\n\nDo you want to continue?
Please note: By sharing the log, you could share sensitive data like location data or your Home Assistant URL.\n\nDo you want to continue?

Use the below sections to create your shortcuts. Once you have added a shortcut you will need to drag it on your home screen after long pressing on the app icon. Although Android supports up to 5 dynamic shortcuts most launchers will only show 4 shortcuts.
Make sure to change the ID below for each new shortcut you want to add otherwise the existing ID will be updated. There are no limits to the amount of pinned shortcuts you can create.
Not all launchers support displaying 5 shortcuts, you may not see this shortcut if the above 4 are already added.
Sharing logs with the Home Assistant team will help to solve issues. Please share the logs only if you have been asked to do so by a Home Assistant developer
Request to install app on wear device sent successfully
Play Store Request Failed. Wear device(s) may not support Play Store, that is, the Wear device may be version 1.0.
Set template in the phone settings
Provide a template below that will be displayed on the Wear OS template tile.
Render any template with HTML formatting
Tile data is missing, please set it up in App Configuration
Select a entity to toggle or call (required)
You must have one of the following domains in order to use this feature: cover, fan, input_boolean, light, remote, scene, script, switch
Unable to process notification \"%1$s\" as text to speech.
Please set a title for text to speech to process
Unable to parse your Home Assistant URL. It should look like https://example.com
Select your favorite entities to appear at the top of the wear home screen. You can also drag and drop to change the order in which they appear.
Listening to Home Assistant via Websocket
Unsupported authentication scheme (not basic or digest), please check network settings.
User authentication failed on server, please check server settings.
Failed to perform SSL handshake, please ensure your certificate is valid.
Server or proxy hostname lookup failed, please check that the URL is a valid Home Assistant URL.
User authentication failed on proxy, please check proxy settings.
The date of the Home Assistant certificate is invalid, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
The Home Assistant certificate has expired, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
The Home Assistant Hostname certificate mismatch, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
A generic SSL error occurred when loading Home Assistant, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
The Home Assistant certificate is not yet valid, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
The Home Assistant certificate authority is not trusted, please review the Home Assistant certificate or the connection settings and try again.
There was an error loading Home Assistant, please review the connection settings and try again. We will attempt to try another provided URL when you click on Refresh.

This app connects to your Home Assistant server and allows integrating data about you and your phone.\n\nHome Assistant is free and open source home automation software with a focus on local control and privacy.
Unable to load Home Assistant home page, do you have a browser installed?
A custom component is preventing service data from loading.
Unable to fetch data for configured entity.
Unable to send zone event to Home Assistant
Failed to send config request to wear device
Application name or package name of the last used application on the device
Manage when we are in direct communication with your server via websockets.

Please select when you would like the application to attempt to directly communicate with your Home Assistant instance for all communication. This will include push notifications, if you are on a minimal build this needs to be always to consistently get push notifications.

In order to maintain the websocket connection the app will need to create a persistent notification. You may use the button below to manage the appearance of this notification. It is recommended to minimize the notification to hide the icon.
Manage all notification channels configured on the device. Channels control the behavior of its notifications including visibility and sound.
Show the change log dialog from when the app was updated
Select a icon for the tile
